Updated RSS Feeds

370 words written on Tue, Feb 25 2003

Said Links section is no longer part of the default RSS feed (that any of you reading this via RSS are subscribed to). To subscribe to the Links section, just pass ?cat=Links as a variable, for example:

http://www.danielsjourney.com/rss.php?cat=Links

You can also subscribe to any category with the same variable, for example if you are for some very odd reason only interested in my daily mintia you can subcribe to this flavor. This feature is also on the main site, by the way, that‚Äôs how the links to each category work.

However the customization of the feed doesn‚Äôt stop there. Oh no. you also have:

?l=short ‚Äì get a short/blurb/teaser post with a link to the website. this is how most peps do their feed, but a few weeks back i went to full posts because that‚Äôs what i like to get in my newsreader.

?n=5 ‚Äì get specified number of posts at a time. the default is 10, same as it‚Äôs been for some time. but you can do me a bandwidth favor if you hit the RSS feed more than once every 2 hours and get, say, 5 (of course if your newsreader support LAST_MODIFIED then we‚Äôre getting along, bandwidth-wise at least, already). if you have a really crazy newsreader polling every 10 minutes just get 1, max 2‚Äìreally, i can‚Äôt even post them that fast‚Ä¶or if, on the other hand, you never seem to fire up your newsreader but once on the weekend you can get 30.

?img=yes ‚Äì default is no images in the newsfeed, i find them kinda annoying when people use them in every post. i don‚Äôt, though, so if you don‚Äôt want to have to go to the site to see the occasional image, pass this variable as ‚Äúyes‚Äù and you will get the images embedded in the post. still no media, flash, or anything else bandwidth-heavy and technologically-funnymoney.

So there you have it. Mix and match RSS feeds. Just string together the variables with &‚Äôs to do any combination. Try any of these flavors for example:

latest five posts with images

latest 10 posts w/o full text

latest 15 Links

etc., etc.
